Yes. If two or more people are editors in a Medium publication, you will both have access to edit any drafts that are created in or submitted to that publication. Therefore, if you wish to co-author, one of you can create a draft in the publication and then both of you can write and edit in the draft. However, the author of the piece will show only the person who created it and there will be a small note at the bottom that says “Thanks to [co-author’s name].” You will have to type your own byline at the top both for author’s names.

You can easily co-author an article on Medoum with another writer - that’s essentially what editors do when you submit to a publication. But whoever created the draft will be the “author.” I think what you’re really asking is can two authors share the byline on a Medium article. And the answer to that, unfortunately is, no. One cool work around is “@“ tagging the other writer at the beginning of the piece. It’s not perfect but it’s better than nothing.

To the best of my understanding, there is no way for two authors to officially share credit for any one story. However, I suppose you could get close enough for government work if you own a publication that you co-edit with other people. Technically any number of the editors can add whatever they want to any document in the pub, but credit and earnings would still go to whomever the original author was. True co-authoring would be a really interesting future development, though.
